material.mattext: Across the films we studied (The Machinist, Identity, Fight Club, Rain Man, K-PAX, Leaving Las Vegas, Nuremberg, Wind River), which psychological theme appeared most consistently?
Genetic determination of behavior
Identity fragmentation or distortion - whether through dissociation, delusion, trauma, or institutional dehumanization
Financial motivation for all actions
Random chance determining outcomes

Correct!

Across all eight films, identity disturbance is the central theme: - The Machinist: Trevor creates Ivan to fragment guilty self - Identity: Malcolm's personality fragmentation - Fight Club: Narrator/Tyler dissociation - Rain Man: Raymond's autism affecting identity/connection - K-PAX: Prot's possible trauma-induced identity - Leaving Las Vegas: Ben's dissolved identity through alcoholism - Nuremberg: How ideology fragments moral identity - Wind River: Natalie's dehumanization; institutional erasure of Indigenous identity

The correct answer is B.

Across all eight films, identity disturbance is the central theme: - The Machinist: Trevor creates Ivan to fragment guilty self - Identity: Malcolm's personality fragmentation - Fight Club: Narrator/Tyler dissociation - Rain Man: Raymond's autism affecting identity/connection - K-PAX: Prot's possible trauma-induced identity - Leaving Las Vegas: Ben's dissolved identity through alcoholism - Nuremberg: How ideology fragments moral identity - Wind River: Natalie's dehumanization; institutional erasure of Indigenous identity

Why other answers are incorrect:

  • A: Genetics rarely discussed; psychological and social factors predominate.
  • C: While present in some films, not the central theme.
  • D: Films show meaningful psychological causation, not randomness.
According to emotion differentiation research (Kashdan et al., 2015; Kalokerinos et al., 2019), which character demonstrated the MOST impaired emotion differentiation?
Raymond Babbitt (followed clear routines)
Ben Ferencz (channeled grief into purpose)
Trevor Reznik (could not identify the source of overwhelming distress, leading to complete reality distortion)
Prot (maintained consistent alternative identity)

Correct!

Kalokerinos et al.'s research shows low differentiators struggle to identify what they're feeling and show ineffective regulation. Trevor exemplifies this: he experiences overwhelming negative affect but cannot identify its source (guilt about the hit-and-run). This undifferentiated distress led to maladaptive regulation (insomnia, delusion, projection). He literally cannot tell what he's feeling, which is why he creates Ivan - a concrete, external "cause" for his nameless distress.

The correct answer is C.

  • D: Whether delusional or alien, Prot maintains coherent emotional presentation.
McKnight & Kashdan (2009) propose that purpose functions as a self-organizing system. Which character's trajectory best demonstrates how trauma can either destroy OR reorganize purpose?
Ben Sanderson (purpose destroyed without reorganization)
Malcolm Rivers (purpose fragmented into competing systems)
Cory Lambert (trauma reorganized into justice-seeking purpose)
The Narrator/Tyler Durden (purpose fragmented into competing identities)

Correct!

The question asks about trauma reorganizing purpose, which implies successful (if painful) adaptation. Cory Lambert demonstrates this: his daughter's death could have destroyed him (like Ben) or fragmented him (like Malcolm). Instead, the trauma reorganized his purpose system around justice - protecting other vulnerable people, honoring his daughter's memory through action. His purpose is painful but functional, directed, and meaning-generating.

The correct answer is C.

Boudry & Braeckman (2012) describe how self-validating belief systems resist disconfirmation. Which film most clearly demonstrated institutional (rather than individual) self-validating beliefs?
K-PAX (individual delusion)
Fight Club (individual dissociation)
Nuremberg (Nazi ideology as systematically self-validating institutional belief)
Rain Man (individual autism)

Correct!

Nuremberg most clearly shows INSTITUTIONAL self-validating beliefs. Nazi ideology wasn't just individual delusion - it was a systematic belief system that operated at institutional level, with built-in immunizing strategies: racial science "proved" Aryan superiority, Jewish conspiracy theories explained any challenges, state legitimacy justified any action. The belief system was self-validating at the societal level, making individual resistance extremely difficult.

The correct answer is C.

  • B: Individual dissociation, not institutional belief.
  • D: Autism is neurological, not a belief system.

The course examined six governing areas of inquiry: BELIEF, PURPOSE, MOTIVATION, UNCERTAINTY, DISCOMFORT, and EMOTION. Based on all films and readings, which statement best captures their relationship?
Each operates independently in isolated psychological modules
BELIEF is the master construct determining all others
These are merely different words for the same phenomenon

They form an interconnected system - beliefs shape emotional interpretation, emotions drive motivation, uncertainty threatens purpose, and discomfort motivates belief change - requiring integrated analysis

Correct!

The course demonstrated interconnection throughout: - Beliefs shape emotional interpretation (Teddy's delusion structures his emotional life) - Emotions drive motivation (Charlie's growing affection motivates care for Raymond) - Uncertainty threatens purpose (Lambert's certainty about justice enables purpose) - Discomfort motivates belief change (or belief defense - the Nuremberg defendants) The six areas require integrated analysis because changes in one ripple through others.

The correct answer is D.

The course demonstrated interconnection throughout: - Beliefs shape emotional interpretation (Teddy's delusion structures his emotional life) - Emotions drive motivation (Charlie's growing affection motivates care for Raymond) - Uncertainty threatens purpose (Lambert's certainty about justice enables purpose) - Discomfort motivates belief change (or belief defense - the Nuremberg defendants) The six areas require integrated analysis because changes in one ripple through others.

Why other answers are incorrect:

  • A: The films consistently showed interconnection.
  • B: No single construct is primary; relationships are bidirectional.
  • C: The constructs are related but meaningfully distinct.
